name: Jessup
detailed_location: Boulder CityRuined section(Great Khan hideout)Help the Great Khans in Boulder City:Red Rock Canyon

topics.response_text: {Player attacked NCR, NCR troops not all dead}Kill every last one of those NCR troopers and then we'll talk.

topics.topic_text: Why don't you just shoot your way out of here?
topics.response_text: I'm not afraid of a gunfight, but I'd rather get back to Red Rock without a few extra holes in me if I can help it.

topics.topic_text: The troopers are all dead. You're free to go.
topics.response_text: Yeah, that's a pretty piece of work. Makes me wonder why you'd turn on the NCR, especially when they had us cold.
Yeah,{as in, "go on, get out"}go on.
And here I thought us Great Khans were tough to kill. So, what happens now?

topics.topic_text: Not quite. When I kill you, however, the job will get done right.
topics.response_text: You think you can take me, punk?

topics.topic_text: The NCR troopers have been paid to look the other way.
topics.response_text: Then we are out of here. Here - a souvenir for you. It's Benny's lighter. Shove it up his ass when you catch up with him.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about settling things between you and the NCR.
topics.response_text: What's to negotiate? The NCR backs off, we walk out of here, nobody gets hurt.
Don't have it. Benny stole it, right before he stabbed us in the back. He's probably back at the Strip by now, laughing at me.

topics.topic_text: Well, I'm not, and I believe you have something of mine.
What can you tell me about Benny?
topics.response_text: He's one of the Chairmen, big shots who run The Tops casino in New Vegas. A friend from the city contacted me with info on a big job.

topics.topic_text: Never mind. Let's talk about something else.
Any chance you're willing to surrender?
topics.response_text: And face NCR "justice?" No thanks. I'd rather not spend the next ten years doing hard labor.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about the Platinum Chip?
topics.response_text: Just a big, fancy poker chip as far as I know. Don't know why anyone would make one out of platinum, though.

topics.topic_text: I'm willing to hear other suggestions.
topics.response_text: {Jessup mentions bribe option}We'd try to bribe our way out, but seeing as how Benny didn't pay us yet, that won't happen.
He's a snake, that's why. He owed us the rest of the pay for the job, so maybe he didn't want to pay up.

topics.topic_text: Free the hostages now, and I'll have the NCR escort you out of their territory.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I can't believe I'm doing this, but all right, the hostages can go. The NCR had better keep their end of the deal, though.

topics.topic_text: I'm a ghost, here to haunt you. Oooooh...
topics.response_text: {annoyed at the player's flippant reaction}All right, quit fucking around. You survived and you tracked us down. What now?

conversation.response_text: Yeah,{as in, "go on, get out"}go on.

description:
Jessup is a 38 year-old Caucasian Male.

A seasoned Great Khan mercenary and squad leader who found himself stranded in Boulder City after being betrayed by Benny during a mission to ambush a package courier.

Jessup's Personality: Loyal to his fellow Great Khans above all else, principled but pragmatic when it comes to survival, quietly vengeful, and protective of his fellow Khans. He values family bonds deeply and is willing to defy authority to protect those under his command.

Jessup's Backstory: Jessup has been with the Great Khans for many years, serving as a trusted squad leader. He was part of the group led by Benny that traveled to Goodsprings to ambush the Courier. While he initially objected to the murder on ethical grounds, he was persuaded by his partner McMurphy to go along with the plan. Throughout the journey, he watched over fellow Khan Chance, who was struggling with chem addiction stemming from the Bitter Springs Massacre. After Chance's suspicious death and McMurphy's fatal wounds during an NCR patrol confrontation in Boulder City, Jessup found himself stranded with a handful of remaining Khans when Benny fled with the Platinum Chip.
